title: Presentation: Saline and Sodic Soils: Understanding Differences and Management Solutions

tasks.task: Participate in a seminar on soil health management, including:
subtasks: Raise awareness about increasing precipitation in South Dakota and its impact on existing saline and sodic soils.
Differentiate between saline (calcium and magnesium) and sodic (sodium) soil issues, describing their formation and management challenges.
Discuss soil testing protocols for evaluating salt issues, including EC measurement and interpretation of SAR and ESP values.
Evaluate the depth of soil sampling and irrigation practices for sodium detection and movement within the soil profile.
Present chemical amendment strategies (e.g., gypsum, elemental sulfur) to manage excessive sodium through cation exchange and lowering soil pH.
Document the role of cover crops in stabilizing soil structure and managing sodium dynamics in affected fields.
Review the case study examples from South Dakota farms demonstrating successful soil remediation methods.
Adapt management advice to local conditions, emphasizing the importance of site-specific assessments and farmer collaboration.
Solicit questions from audience members on soil health management and address any concerns regarding field applicability.
